item.title: Danae add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "But I think there are a set of experiences that turn a potential writer into a working writer, and then there are places in your life were you start to recognize what you want to do." -- Stephen King

item.title: Danae add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "All my life I've looked at words as though I were seeing them for the first time." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Danae add a quote by Michael Crichton
item.description: "In the information society, nobody thinks. We expected to banish paper, but we actually banished thought." -- Michael Crichton

item.title: Danae add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "I wish I could write as mysterious as a cat." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Danae add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "In utter loneliness a writer tries to explain the inexplicable... The writer must believe that what he is doing is the most important thing in the world. And he must hold to this illusion even when he knows it is not true." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Danae add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Each has his past shut in him like the leaves of a book known to him by heart and his friends can only read the title." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Danae add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "And poets, in my view, and I think the view of most people, do speak God's language - it's better, it's finer, it's language on a higher plane than ordinary people speak in their daily lives." -- Stephen King

item.title: Danae add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "All things truly wicked start from innocence." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Danae add a quote by Edgar Allan Poe
item.description: "I would define, in brief, the poetry of words as the rhythmical creation of beauty." -- Edgar Allan Poe

item.title: Danae add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "I am impelled, not to squeak like a grateful and apologetic mouse, but to roar like a lion out of pride in my profession." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Danae add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "A woman must have money and a room of her own if she is to write fiction." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Danae add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Even in literature and art, no man who bothers about originality will ever be original: whereas if you simply try to tell the truth (without caring twopence how often it has been told before) you will, nine times out of ten, become original without ever having noticed it." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Danae add a quote by William Wordsworth
item.description: "Fill your paper with the breathings of your heart." -- William Wordsworth

item.title: Danae add a quote by Nathaniel Hawthorne
item.description: "Easy reading is damn hard writing." -- Nathaniel Hawthorne

item.title: Danae add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Fiction is like a spider's web, attached ever so slightly perhaps, but still attached to life at all four corners. Often the attachment is scarcely perceptible." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Danae add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "A man's got to take a lot of punishment to write a really funny book." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Danae add a quote by Stephen King
item.description: "And as a writer, one of the things that I've always been interested in doing is actually invading your comfort space. Because that's what we're supposed to do. Get under your skin, and make you react." -- Stephen King

item.title: Danae add a quote by Nathaniel Hawthorne
item.description: "Nobody has any conscience about adding to the improbabilities of a marvelous tale." -- Nathaniel Hawthorne

item.title: Danae add a quote by Virgina Woolf
item.description: "I was in a queer mood, thinking myself very old: but now I am a woman again - as I always am when I write." -- Virgina Woolf

item.title: Danae add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Cowardice... is almost always simply a lack of ability to suspend functioning of the imagination." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Danae add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Every secret of a writer's soul, every experience of his life, every quality of his mind is written large in his works." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Danae add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Danae add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Danae add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Danae add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Danae add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Danae add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Danae add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Danae add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Danae add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous
